Sentencas: The outstanding oxygen permeability of the perovskite Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-delta (BSCF) and its applicability as a cathode in solid oxide fuel cells are remarkable, yet have been hindered by the formation of secondary phases at T < 840 degrees C and the subsequent degradation.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: The other main drawback to BSCF is related to the formation of carbonates in the presence of CO2.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: These degrade its excellent oxygen surface-exchange kinetics.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: In this work, 10% Y-doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-delta (BSCF10Y) is electrochemically, microstructurally, and chemically characterized in O-2- and CO2-containing atmospheres as porous cathodes in symmetrical cells with Gd-doped ceria as electrolyte.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: Experiments in oxygen/nitrogen gas mixtures (pO(2) = 0.02-0.40 atm) at T = 600-900 degrees C showed high performance with a cathode specific resistance of 49.9 m Omega cm(2) at 600 degrees C in air (pO(2) = 0.21 atm), which is very comparable to 47.8 m Omega cm(2) for undoped BSCF, but which deteriorates constantly under the same conditions.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: Moreover, adding significant amounts of CO2 (from 1% to 3% vol) to air at 700 degrees C shows that BSCF10Y has a remarkably enhanced tolerance toward the adsorption of CO2 molecules (compared to the undoped BSCF cathodes).
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: The electrode microstructure was analyzed by focused ion beam (FIB) combined with scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: The chemical composition was analyzed by scanning transmission electron spectroscopy (STEM) combined with energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDXS).
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: The presence of secondary phases in the BSCF10Y cathodes was strongly reduced or even suppressed compared to undoped BSCF, which explains the superior oxygen reduction reaction kinetics over time.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: Also, the segregated volume fraction of carbonates is greatly reduced after 50 h in 1% CO2.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures

Sentencas: The improved stability of the cubic phase in BSCF10Y compared to BSCF is linked to the monovalent agent and higher radius of the Y-dopant, while the improved stability in CO2-containing atmospheres is attributed to the higher acidity of Y3+ compared to the A-site cations and the high concentration of the Y-dopant, which is located on both the A-and B-sites of the perovskite.
Titulo: Improved Phase Stability and CO2 Poisoning Robustness of Y-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ SOFC Cathodes at Intermediate Temperatures
